components.description:
A yellow face with a small, closed mouth, flat or frowning, rolling its large, white eyes upwards. As with the gesture of an eye-roll, commonly conveys moderate disdain, disapproval, frustration, or boredom. Tone varies, including playful, sassy, resentful, and sarcastic, as if saying Yeah, whatever.

Samsung's design previously depicted a face smiling and looking to the side.
components.title: Face with Rolling Eyes

As with the gesture of an eye-roll, commonly conveys moderate disdain, disapproval, frustration, or boredom. title: Face with Rolling Eyes

version.description: The Unicode Consortium has approved the following 41 emoji characters as part of Unicode 8.0, released on June 17, 2015. This is comprised of 37 new emojis, plus five emoji modifiers. Find out more about this update on the Emojipedia Blog.

emoji_net_data.definition: A face displaying eyes glancing upward, indicating an eye-roll. This is used to show disdain, contempt or boredom about a person or topic. C http://emojipedia.org/face-with-rolling-eyes/
emoji_net_data.name: face with rolling eyes

bn:00083024v: To hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of.
To prevent; to halt; to cause to fail; to foil; to frustrate.
Hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00032512n: An organ of vision that detects light
Organ that detects light and converts it into electro-chemical impulses in neurons
The two eyes of a human being considered as a whole.
A window or other opening that has an oval or circular shape (as of an eye).
An organ through which animals see.
Eyes are sensory organs of the face responsible for sight.
An oculus, plural oculi, from Latin oculus: eye, denotes a circular opening in the center of a dome or in a wall.
Eyes are the organs of vision.
The part of the eye having a spherical shape.
The organ that is sensitive to light, which it converts to electrical signals passed to the brain, by which means animals see.

bn:00025856n: In psychology, frustration is a common emotional response to opposition.
The feeling that accompanies an experience of being thwarted in attaining your goals
An emotional response to circumstances where one is obstructed from arriving at a goal.
